meanings.definition: The quality or state of being small in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The minuteness of the toy car made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: I marveled at the minuteness of the intricate snowflake under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled at the minuteness of the clue left behind.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the minuteness of the tiny squirrel seemed insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The minuteness of the pebble in his shoe caused him great discomfort.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being precise or detailed.
meanings.sent1: The minuteness of the instructions ensured no mistakes were made.
meanings.sent2: She admired the minuteness of the artist's brush strokes in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef's minuteness in measuring ingredients led to a perfect cake.
meanings.sent4: His minuteness in planning the trip left no room for error.
meanings.sent5: The minuteness of the map's details helped them navigate through the maze.
